location: Australia, Taiwan, New Zealand, United Kingdom, Canada, UAE
introduction: I am the founder of the purpose-led consultancy Impact Dragonfly. I work with businesses, institutions, and communities to engage with sustainability in a meaningful and practical way. This is done through tailored workshops, strategic coaching and collaborative design experiences, helping my clients connect sustainability with everyday decisions, long-term planning and positive impact.
service_approach: Engage with sustainability in meaningful and practical way
client_outcomes: Connect sustainability with everyday decisions, long-term planning and positive impact
top_3_advice: Start small but stay intentional — every action builds momentum.
Don't try to do everything alone; sustainability thrives through collaboration.
Bring people on the journey — when you connect values to action, change sticks.
how_help_users: I could help others who are also running small consultancies build confidence in their unique voice and strengths. I know how isolating it can feel at the beginning, so I love supporting others to find clarity, grow their networks, and build a community around their work. There's so much power in collaboration over competition — especially in the sustainability space.
consultancy_support_areas: Build confidence in unique voice and strengths
philosophy: Power in collaboration over competition — especially in the sustainability space
sustainability_journey: I came into sustainability through a mix of curiosity, conviction, and a recognition of a real gap in the market. I noticed that many organisations were appointing a single sustainability manager and expecting them to drive massive, organisation-wide change — often without the resources, support, or engagement needed to succeed. What particularly struck me was how often the technical side of sustainability was covered, while the human side — the engagement, the culture shift, the storytelling — was missing.

market_gap_identified.problem: Organizations appointing single sustainability manager to drive massive organization-wide change without resources, support, or engagement
market_gap_identified.missing_element: Human side - engagement, culture shift, storytelling
market_gap_identified.technical_vs_human: Technical side covered, human side missing

background_alignment: With my background in facilitation, communication and behavioural change, I realised that I could help bridge that gap. I could support sustainability managers and businesses by building internal buy-in, creating shared understanding, and transforming sustainability from a compliance task into a collaborative journey.
value_proposition: Transforming sustainability from compliance task into collaborative journey
impact_dragonfly_genesis: That's really what sparked Impact Dragonfly — combining strategy with engagement to make sustainability something that people feel they are part of, not just responsible for.
approach_philosophy: Combining strategy with engagement to make sustainability something people feel part of, not just responsible for
sustainable_actions: As an organisation, we walk the talk — continually learning, staying curious, and exploring innovation in the sustainability space. This mindset is key to driving meaningful change within our own business and for our clients.
challenges_overcome: Starting off alone and building my network was one of the biggest challenges. Like many founders, I had a clear vision but limited connections in the space when I began. It took time — and a lot of showing up — to find my people. I leaned into collaboration, attended events, volunteered, and reached out to others doing good work. Slowly, I built a strong network of like-minded professionals who are now collaborators, clients, and friends.
network_building_strategy: Reached out to others doing good work
network_outcomes: Strong network of like-minded professionals who are now collaborators, clients, and friends
founder_challenges: I also had to learn to balance wearing many hats — facilitator, strategist, business owner — all while staying aligned with my values. The key was staying grounded in purpose, being open to learning, and celebrating progress, not perfection.
proudest_achievement: I'm most proud of staying motivated and committed, even when the climate crisis feels overwhelming or the political environment seems to be working against progress. It's easy to feel discouraged in this space — but I've learned to focus on what I can influence: Celebrating the wins (big and small), and continuously showing up with hope, creativity, and determination.

resilience_approach.strategy: Focus on what I can influence
actions: Continuously showing up with hope, creativity, and determination

business_pride: Building a business rooted in purpose and helping others take positive action, even in the face of uncertainty, is something I'm truly proud of.
purpose_driven_business: Business rooted in purpose helping others take positive action in face of uncertainty
solution_categories_covered: Waste Management - Office - Meeting rooms - Printer Rooms & Others
Sustainable Supply Chain & Logistic - Sustainable Supply Chain Strategy
Sustainable Supply Chain & Logistic - Organisation Engagement
Carbon Management & Carbon Footprint - Awareness & Training
engagement_focus: Human side of sustainability - engagement, culture shift, storytelling
transformation_goal: Transform sustainability from compliance task into collaborative journey
